intro: Sinapis arvensis subsp. orientalis, commonly known as oriental mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom in early summer, and it is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. This species is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
